events.text:
This is a demo example of using a modified plugin I created from modifying other plugins (see below) to produced a procedural lighting effect for up to 50 lights.  I updated / combined 2 different existing plugins by Mikal / kindeyegames with his permission which were also ports of other effects.  I liked different aspects of both the below, primarily I wanted the normal maps to be generated automatically to save me time, and I preferred the controls of the NormalMapExtended but also wanted to increase the light count from 3 to 50.

NormalMapExtended: Mikal, ported from donelwero and matriax
https://www.construct.net/en/make-games/addons/194/normalmapextended

NormalMapProcedural: Mikal, ported from https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4ss3W7
https://www.construct.net/en/make-games/addons/350/normalmapprocedural

1.1.2 Update: Added the ability to turn Light 1 On/Off and made it apparent that you can dim the light by setting the "Light X State 0/1" parameter to something in between such as 0.5.

Additional note, while the number of lights has been increased, as you go up in lights, you will notice performance start to take a hit on CPU.  I personally noted about a ~30% range in CPU between 1 and 50 lights.

1.1.3 Update: Fixed (hopefully) a bug for OSX which had issues with effects stacking.

1.1.3.1 Update: Added example equations for how to set WW, WH, WWL, WHL and light X and Y when Fullscreen quality is set to "High" in project settings.  Current project uses "Low" so it is toggled to disabled but wanted to add as a reference.

1.1.3.2 Update: Used the newer and more reliable equations for setting WW, WH, WWL, WHL and light X and Y when Fullscreen quality is set to "High" in project settings.  Current project uses "Low" so it is toggled to disabled but wanted to add as a reference.

1.1.3.3 Update: My "newer and more reliable equations" in 1.1.3.2 were wrong! I have updated the equations and they are now accurate as far as I can tell for "High".  I am going to save 2 project files, one for high and one for low quality fullscreen options.

Good luck!
FoozleCC
Needed for low full screen quality
